intro: Erysimum slavjankae, commonly known as the Slavjanka wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces bright yellow or orange flowers in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Erysimum slavjankae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
